meta.description: Hackerspace NTNU, a student-led project open to all students, offers access to new technology like 3D printers and VR equipment. Our members provide varied expertise to help with your projects, from making an LED light blink to creating a 3D model. Visit our workshop or join our Slack channel for assistance or a friendly chat.

layout.utilitiesDescription: Feel free to send a to DevOps or use the #dev-public channel on Slack! You can also report errors or suggest improvements on GitHub.

news.title: News
news.readTime: {count, plural, =0 {less than a minute} one {# minute} other {# minutes}} read

about.WhatIsHackerspace_info: <p1> Hackerspace NTNU is a student-driven project from IDI and is open to all students regardless of their field of study. At our place, you will find new technology at your disposal, including 3D printers and Virtual Reality equipment.</p1> <p2> Whether you are a first-year student who needs help with your first Arduino project or a fourth-year student who wants to create a 3D model of Trondheim, we can provide both equipment and expertise. We also regularly offer courses for both beginners and advanced users in many exciting topics. </p2> <p3> Come by to see what we are doing and have a chat. </p3> You will find us on the second floor of the A-building at Realfagbygget, NTNU Gl√∏shaugen.
about.Answer_1: <p1> All students can use 3D printers and the rest of the workshop regardless of being a member of Hackerspace or not. We have a reservation system available to all students with FEIDE login from the website's navigation bar. </p1> <p2>Come in during opening hours and get help from our members. </p2>
about.Answer_2: Our VR equipment can be borrowed and tried out by all students regardless of membership in Hackerspace. We have our own VR room where you can come and play as long as a Hackerspace member is available at setup and closing. The equipment can be loaned out in the usual way through the warehouse system. Come by during our opening hours if this interests you.
about.Answer_3: <p1> Hackerspace has ongoing admissions. You can therefore apply whenever you want. We usually respond within 3 working weeks. </p1><p2> Note that you don't need a membership to borrow equipment or try something cool. Come in for a chat during our opening hours to find out more about our offer and what it's like to be a member. </p2>
about.About_Leaderboard: The leaderboard team includes Leader, Secound-in-command, finiancal manager in Hackerspace. They ensure the optimal operation of Hackerspace NTNU and handle decision-making and planning of operations with the board.
